text: GREGORY GOTTWALD, having been first duly sworn, testified as follows: EXAMINATION
My name's Eric Mayer, and we're here for a post-judgment deposition. Would you please state your name for the record.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: My name is Gregory Charles Gottwald.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is your current address, Mr. Gottwald?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  What is your spouse's name?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: She lives at the same address.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you have any children with Misaabrana?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Thomas Stone Gottwald.  And then I have two stepchildren that I've raised since they were five, that are hers, for a total of six children.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And who is the mother of the stepchildren?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, she is the mother of my stepchildren.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you have any other children by any other women?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What was your first wife's wife?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And when did you marry Misaabrana?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you have a separate property agreement with Misaabrana?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: So community property is what you have?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: How about with your first wife, did you have any kind of separate property agreement with her?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What is your Social Security number?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I'm not sure what her Social Security number is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I want to focus on where you receive income, from any source, so let's start with what moneys do you receive from Duratech Texas, LLC, your current employer?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I -- my payroll paycheck is 1,500 per month, and with an additional $2,500 used for paying house lease, electric, things of that nature.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Let's talk about Duratech Texas, LLC.  Who are the officers of Duratech Texas, LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What is Mr. Lodhi's relation to you?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Is he a partner with you in any other --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And when was Duratech Texas, LLC formed?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Would the documents with the Texas Secretary of State be the best evidence of when it was --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Did you contribute any money or assets to Duratech Texas, LLC, when it was formed?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Did Mr. Wajid contribute any money or assets to Texas Duratech, LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: How was that organization capitalized, at its inception?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, we got a couple of loans.  Actually, not at that time.  It came probably about eight months or a year later, that we got a loan.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Who provided the loans?  Which institution?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And had you had any prior dealings with Square Capital?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: We did, but not in the -- only as a merchant, merchant services provider.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Explain how much Square Capital loaned Duratech Texas, LLC.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I believe, at that time, it was 25,000.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And today, what's the amount of the loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, we paid off that loan.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then we received another loan for, I believe, 33,000, and I think we have paid back 17,000 of that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Are there any other owners of Duratech Texas, LLC besides you and Mr. Wajid?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And how is the ownership divided?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And are you the managing partner of that LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Are there any other officers, besides yourself?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does any of your family work for the LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Periodically.  Just -- I have my son, he does maintenance on our equipment, from time to time, but he's not a full-time employee.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We were talking about where you receive income.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: So you said you receive a certain amount of income, monthly, from Duratech Texas, LLC. Do you have income from any other entity or source?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No other entity, no other source.  I provide for many, many dependents.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you have a separate bank account for Texas -- for Duratech Texas, LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Which bank do you bank with?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Do you have a personal banking account for yourself?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And which bank do you bank with?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Does your wife have a personal banking account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And what bank does she bank with?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you have banking accounts with any entities, currently, other than Chase?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And what entities are those?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: It's a -- it's really a dormant account.  It's just been open since, I think, 2008, and it's got, maybe, 25 bucks in it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is it in your name?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Is it in anyone else's name?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other bank accounts that you have, your spouse has, or any business in which you have an interest, has?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Do you have a safety deposit box?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does your spouse have a safety deposit box?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does your spouse have any income from any source?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No.  She's working on -- she has some disabilities, so she's working on some Social Security income, but we're working through that.  She's got some pretty severe disabilities.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But to date, she has not received --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- any disability income from the Federal or State --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And have you received any income from state or federal agencies at any time?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Let's talk about what you owe people.  Okay? You mentioned that there's an outstanding loan, with Square, that you guys have paid approximately half off; is that right?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Are there any other people or entities that you owe money to?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I owe money to -- I owe $25,000 for a loan to our business.  I don't have the details on it, but I can get it from my accountant.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Obviously, I'm going to request that. While we're on that point, who is your accountant?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And how long has Mr. Wajid Lodhi been your accountant?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Prior to that, who did you use as an accountant?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: We didn't have one, really.  It was -- we just tried to do what we could with what we had.  We tried QuickBooks and things of that nature.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So I would request those materials.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I'm not sure.  I'll have to find out.  He arranged it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you know what the outstanding balance of that loan is, today?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And is there a regular payment that has to be made on that loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And do you know, approximately, how much that is?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And how is that paid?  Is it paid by check?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I think he does a bank transfer.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And it would come from which account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Are there any other entities that you receive income from, other than Duratech Texas, LLC?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And in terms of loans, are there any other loans that you have, other than the ones that you have described so far?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I have one to William Bare for -- I believe it's pretty close to 16,000.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sixteen thousand dollars.  And what is that loan for?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Living expenses and things during the flood.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is the outstanding balance on it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: It's -- I haven't paid anything on it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What relation is he to you?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And I take it, it's an unsecured loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And loan to -- are any of the loans, secured loans, that you've described?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Only by our bank account.  The Square account is secured by our bank account.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is the security for the Square loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: The way that we pay the loan back is a percentage of our credit card charges.  So 20 percent of every credit card we process, they keep.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So Square is the little device you put on a --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- mobile phone, that accepts credit cards?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, that's the processing part of it, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But that's the entity from which --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And it's paid back through a 20 percent charge on any credit card --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- that you process from your customers?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Right now, today, are there any other loans or people that you owe money to, either personally or through any business that you have an ownership interest in, other than what you have described to us?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Mr. Bare, is there a due date on that loan, or is it pay when you can?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, I would assume that it's when we can.  I mean it's -- it's a point of contention.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And has he asked for it to be repaid?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And what have you told him?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I told him that as we can, we will.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And have you made any principal payments on that loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  We've talked about money that's coming in, and I just want to make sure I cover the waterfront, completely. Are there any other sources of revenue that you have, other than what we've talked about?  And by that, I mean, do you own stock, do you have a CD, things like that.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  No investment income; is that correct?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And you don't own any stocks or bonds or securities or promissory notes; is that right?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Have you loaned money to anyone else?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And have you -- let's talk about what you own. Okay?  What's the address where you're currently living?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: How long have you lived there?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Since -- I guess this is my third year.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that house or owned or rented?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Prior to that address, where did you live?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I lived at Everett Oaks.  I don't remember the street, but it was a house owned by my in-laws.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever owned a house?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What house was that, when you did own it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And what happened with that house?  You sold it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And it was sold, as a result of the divorce?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Since 2001, have you owned any real property in the State of Texas?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Where is that real property?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Describe what you owned in Cypress.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Two-acre piece of property that our business was on, that was flooded.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  What was the address of that property?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you own that property today?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: 2014 or '15.  I don't remember.  It was shortly after the flood.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And to whom did you sell it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I don't know.  It's on the closing statement. At closings, you don't meet the buyers, anymore.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you do with the proceeds of that sale?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, there was a debt.  Obviously, I financed it.  And then there was a portion that I owed my ex-wife, from our settlement, which I believe was around 20,000, maybe a little more, and then there was some other debts that I paid off with the money.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that property was sold some years ago, and would I be correct that you have not acquired any real property in the State of Texas since that date?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Do you have any real property ownership interest in property, anywhere?  United States, overseas, anywhere?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And today, as we sit here, neither you, nor any company or business entity in which you have an interest, is an owner of real property.  Is that a correct statement?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Do you have -- did you inherit anything from your parents?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No.  My father's living.  My mother's not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And does your father own any real property?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And do you have siblings?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And are you a beneficiary under your dad's will, to the best of your knowledge?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I don't know.  I would assume.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Does he own a residence?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does he own any other real property?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  How old of a gentleman is he?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And what is the -- if you just had to ballpark, what's the approximate value of his homestead?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Not a lot.  I mean, he lives out in the country.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The house was built in the early 1900s, so not much.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your spouse -- are her parents alive?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And how old are they?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And do you expect your spouse is a beneficiary under her parents' wills?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Possibly.  I mean, I would assume so, but they have their on-and-off times.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Have you sold any property to anybody in the last three years?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And, then, let's talk about equipment.  Does -- do you own any business equipment, to operate your job?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does the business own any equipment?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Describe the equipment that the business owns.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: We own a few hydraulic machines, hydraulic machines to lift houses, we own a few box vans.  They're not really in our company name; they're in my previous partner's name.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm not sure how he has those titled, but I believe it's in B.J., but I'm not sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the -- let's take them one at a time.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: They're just owned by Texas Duratech, LLC, or are they owned by B.J.?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And how about the vehicles, how are they titled?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I believe they're titled -- I don't even know if they're titled, to be honest with you, because we got them on a lease.  So I'm not sure that they're titled. But it would be in B.J.'s name, if they were.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  We were talking about equipment that the company uses to perform its hydraulic -- how many hydraulic lifts --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Three.  And how many box vans?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other equipment that is owned, either by you or by the entities in which you have an ownership interest?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And that's all owned by which entity?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What does B.J. do today, as an entity?  Is it operational?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I don't know.  To be honest with you, I do not know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And who were the owners or participants in B.J.?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, B.J. was going to be my partner, but it never officially became a partnership, so he really wasn't a partner.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Was there ever an entity's name? You know, a business entity that was created?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I do not believe so, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: There may have been one created, but I don't think it was ever charted or...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You have a lawyer here with you today, Mr. Libby.  Are there other lawyers that you employ today?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  For example, to create the LLC that currently operates and employs you, who created that? Which lawyer?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Lodhi.  But he didn't use an attorney.  He went online, did it himself.  He's an Ph.D., in finance, so he knows how to do all that stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And we were talking about accountants.  Any other accountants or bookkeepers that you have used in the last five years?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And if I asked you to list out which bookkeepers or accountants you have used in the last five years, who would those individuals be?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Well, if I've only used one, being Lodhi, that would be the one that I would list.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- you said you used QuickBooks or --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Where would those records be?  Have you produced those to us?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No.  But I can get them from QuickBooks.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Those are things that you have access to?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Right.  Because I asked Lodhi to retain them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So, yeah, we would ask for a copy of those. We were talking about expenses and income and property, real estate and other property.  I noticed that you have some vessels, boats, listed on some of the documents that have been produced here. What watercraft do you own, currently?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And do you own any other property in Clear Lake?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other watercraft that you own?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I own an '83 Chris Craft, just an old boat. It's really just salvage.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Anything else in the warehouse, that is your property?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other watercraft that you own?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Now, let's talk about vehicles.  You own vehicles, I take it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: How about your spouse, does she have a vehicle?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And how about any of your children, do they have vehicles?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: So let's start with you, and then we'll go to each one of them. What vehicles do you own?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And is that titled in your name?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Where is that vehicle?  Like where do you keep it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Do you own any other vehicles?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I think my son's truck is in my name.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What make and model is that?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Any other vehicles, motor vehicles, that you own?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Let's talk about your spouse.  Does she own any vehicles?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  And where is that vehicle kept?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: It's a long story.  She was abducted about a month-and-a-half ago, and missing for four days, and we recovered her vehicle.  When we recovered her, she was face down, nude, on the side of the road, and we recovered her vehicle, so it's not operable.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did she -- does she own any other vehicles?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And is the Jeep -- was it paid off at the time of the --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other vehicles that your spouse owned?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  You told me your son has a truck. You think it could be in your name. Any other vehicles that any of your family are using, that could be either in your name or in Duratech Texas?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Does Duratech Texas own any vehicles other than the box vans we talked about?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And is that vehicle under some type of loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And do you know how much is owed on the loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And do you know who provided the loan?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I'll find out.  I don't know, exactly.  I didn't handle it.  Wajid handled it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And are payments on that vehicle made through the company?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other vehicles that either you, a family member or a business in which you have an interest, owns?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: How about watercraft?  Any other watercraft?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you or your spouse have any type of retirement accounts?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Tax returns.  I think when I came in this morning, your lawyer handed me a document, "Preview Copy - Do Not File, 2018." Did you -- have you filed your 2018 tax return?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Is this document -- I'll pass it to you. Is this document a full and complete copy of that return --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- because this one's not signed, and -- take a look at it and see.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: It is.  I reviewed it, and I'm the one that provided it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  I notice that it's not a joint return.  Why is that?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: My wife just files her own.  I think she files her own and I file my own.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, I'm not sure if it -- yes.  But I think mine's head of household.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yours is head of household, but you are married, right?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And you -- she files her own tax return?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  So I'd make a request for her tax returns because it's a community property regime.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: She has no income.  She just files it because you're supposed to.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So we'll need to get copies of her income tax returns. I don't know whether this is all of the returns we've asked for, but I will look at the material that you guys have provided, and, if not, I'll follow up with your counsel.  Okay?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Liens or mortgages.  Are there any liens or mortgages, that you're aware of, on any property, other than that we've described?  You told me there's a lien on the F150 truck. Are there any other liens or mortgages on anything that you're aware of, that we haven't already talked about?  I assume the loan from Square is secured by the credit card transfer; is that right?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Any other liens or mortgages, that you're aware of, on any property that you or your family owns or any business in which you have an interest?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Are you scheduled to receive any tax refunds?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Are you scheduled to receive any income from any source, that we haven't talked about already?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Have you transferred any property to your wife in the last three years?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Have you transferred any property to any of your children in the last three years?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Have you transferred property to any family member, either direct family member or through marriage?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Is there any property that you have received an interest in that is not currently in your possession?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Are you the beneficiaries of any trusts?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Are you the trustee in any trust?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Is there any real property located in Montgomery County, that you have an interest in?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Is there any real property located in Harris County, that you have an interest in?  Either you, directly, or any business entity?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No.  I own no property nowhere.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And none of the businesses that you have an interest in, own property, to your knowledge?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: There's only one business that I have an interest in, and it's Duratech Texas, LLC, and we own nothing.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What are you doing today with your business? What type of work are you doing?  How do you get paid? Let's talk about that.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  And how do you typically get paid from the customers of Duratech Texas?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Sometimes by check, sometimes by credit card.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And if you're paid by check, what do you do with those checks?  Are they deposited into a bank account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Of course.  That's the only way you can...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what bank account is that?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Have you used any other bank account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you have a contact at Chase?  Somebody that's responsible for your account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And where did you open the account?  What office?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I didn't open it.  Lodhi opened it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What office did he go to, to open the account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Can you be any more specific?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I can't.  Not today.  I can, later.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you owed any money by Lodhi?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I know, at one time, you had applied for an SBA loan.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Do you recall telling me that --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- I think at the last deposition?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And to do that, you had to fill out paperwork.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Where is that loan application?  Do you have a copy of it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  Did you -- where is it?  Is it online?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: No.  We went to Lone Star College, out in Cypress.  They had a -- several weeks that they set up shop there, to assist people, and we did it there.  And I don't think we retained any copies.  They -- they collected all that documentation.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So, Mr. Libby, I would ask that you -- let's make a double-check, and make sure we don't have any copies of the --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: If I had them, I would certainly provide them. It would be to my benefit to do that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you provided a financial statement to any person or entity in the last five years --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- other than the SBA?  I assume they required something from you.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Already.  So for the cash deposits that we saw, that you made, what would I expect to see in the transaction report, to reflect that withdrawal of cash?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: That's the only way I have to derive cash.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- under your card number, whatever card number you have?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Or a check.  Possibly a check.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now there's something called Thumb Tack.  What is Thumb Tack?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: It is.  It's not really advertising.  It's just people that request a specific service that contact us.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  So there's payments to them on a regular basis?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Mainstream Mediaworks, what do they do?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: That's another -- they are another media company.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Thumb Tack, Google Ads, those are all -- Bing ads, those are payments/expenses for advertising and marketing?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Who is Nick Thiele?  T-H-I-E-L-E.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: He's a media person who manages electronic media.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And he's paid a certain amount of money to --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I see, under totals for automobile -- I'm sorry.  Background checks, there's a company, PublicData.Com.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: We use it to screen our employees.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then under automobile expenses -- is there an automobile lease?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And that's for vehicles that the companies doesn't own, but uses?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Right.  They're the three box vans.  We don't actually have an ownership in them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Rather than take time and go through this, let me -- let's take a break here.  Let me look through, see what I have, and there's some additional material you still have to produce to us, and maybe we can shortcut this.  Okay?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Yeah.  If you provide us with a list, I'm happy to do it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Mr. Gottwald, I'm handing you what I've marked as Exhibit 4.  It looks like a Duratech Texas Chase statement, March 1, 2019, through March 29.  Would you confirm that for me?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: If you'd flip to -- there's a section in there that talks about electronic funds withdrawals.  Right there, I think.  Is that at the bottom?  Let me see? Just pass it here, let me make sure that's the right -- yes, ATM Debit and Cash Withdrawals. This is the section where I should look for the cash that you withdrew to deposit in your personal account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Yes.  But I'm not the only person that makes withdrawals.  There's three people that make withdrawals there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Why don't you pull it out and confirm that.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  So if I see a cash withdrawal, card 4923, that's you?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: All right.  Who is card 321, if you know?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I believe -- I'm not sure, but I think that might be Steve.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And then Wajid, he has his own card.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And you don't loan your card to anyone else?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: You give them the PIN?  You loan your card and give people the PIN?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Not people I don't know, but employees, yeah, that have to go buy materials or things, yeah. Absolutely.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Okay.  And then under electronic withdrawals, that's the section I was going to.  There's a couple of entries.  Would you walk through each one of those.  The first one is payroll?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: That would be payroll to me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So that's how you got paid --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: So I thought you said you went and took out cash to get paid?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What I said was, we use that money to pay for expenses that come out of my personal account.  That's not how I pay myself.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the first entry on the -- that --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Which is reflected in my tax return.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Personal income tax, I believe.  Yeah. Personal income tax.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  Does Duratech Texas have employees, other than you?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Okay.  So that entry, the IRS, is payroll taxes just for you?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Champion Energy, that would be our electric bill.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Progressive Insurance would be an insurance premium.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm not sure.  I'm not sure.  I'd have to look into it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.  And then there's a quick pay to Wajid, for 500.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All depends.  I mean, I don't even get 1,500 a month, some months, so it all depends.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.  Yes.  And then our Internet is the other entry.  Do you want me to keep going?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  That's the last of the electronic --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Those are recurring monthly electronic transfers from that account?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Some of them, yes.  Not all of them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And then on the ATM cash withdrawals, will you take this pen and circle your card number, just on one of the entries, and put your initials by it?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: But that doesn't necessarily mean that I made it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Like there's several here, like Media Works and --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  But that's your card number?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: And, also, if I can add.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Some of this cash -- some of these cash withdrawals, if you'll notice a little further in, there are bank fees.  I think it's like $7,000 in bank fees. They're for NSFs and unpaid checks and insufficient funds and things of that nature. Some of -- most of these withdrawals go to pay for those checks, and you'll see there's a balance there, cash flow being what it is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. MAYER

text: I'll have to get a list of those.  I don't have that with me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. MAYER

speaker: MR. MAYER

text: There's none required.  We're trying to get Bill 6-- I think it's SB 641.  We're trying to get it passed, but --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is that?  I don't know what that is.
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Requiring all foundation repair companies to be licensed.  There's so much competition, it weakens our ability to charge, in order to maintain a good profit so we can do a good service, so we're lobbying to try to get that bill passed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I have the Duratech Texas QuickBooks.  Do you personally use Quicken --
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: -- or do you use any type of software to manage your own personal finances?

text: All right.  And you used that for your previous --

text: Only for a portion of the time.

speaker: MR. MAYER

text: What I would like to do is -- I don't have time to go through the ledgers, obviously, and what I'd like to do is -- we have asked for some additional material.  You've answered my questions; I appreciate it. I'd like to adjourn, let us look at the additional material and see if we have any follow-up questions.  Perhaps, we can handle it through your counsel, rather than reconvene the deposition, on follow-up questions, but that's how we plan to proceed. So we'll adjourn the deposition.  We'll wait for the additional materials, then we'll be in touch with your counsel about how to proceed next.  Okay?
speaker: MR. MAYER

text: Thank you very much, and we appreciate your  --
